message.body: Hello
Hi. I was just on FB to reassure friends that I wasn't in the bldg collapse.
U work near there??
No, but it's the same corner as trader Joe's, where I shop every week. Make that "same intersection": it's on the opposite corner diagonally.
How's your day so far?
Right I was actually there this morning and saw it before it collapsed
I thought they were talking about the demolition next to it at first
Oh jeez. When were you there?
Which corner?
I saw it in a waiting room on TV@10. They didn't say which corner but they said "Sidney Hillman apts", so I looked that up. But now it seems that was th
e wrong corner.
I was directly across st
My day is OK what r u up too
Just trying to undersrand. Collapse was on SE corner?
I'm having lunch now. Then I'm going to rewrite some documentation that I d deleted by mistake, & the backups weren't working.
… after getting a cookie from downstairs.
Nice do u live downtown?
No, w. Philly. you?
I live in Fairmount.
Nice there? I came to phl10-11 years ago and still don't know lots of ths e area
What do u do for work?
Linguistics. I work at Penn, w the LDC, the part that's collecting these texts. They asked us employees to check it out, and sign up if we wanted.
U?
Yea I think its best part. How old r u if you dun mind me asking
I'm 27
& what do you do when not sleeping or playing?
I'm a budget analyst for the Philadelphia school district
Oh boy. Are you on the hot seat these days?
I dunno. I think I'm OK but you never kno
Yeah. (Sigh.) It's a damn shame that kids' educations are so much at risk. Even in the most impersonal view, it's not as if ANYONE in Philadelphia can a
fford to have a (more) undereducated work force.
Yea these school s are going to crumble next year
Gaaah. And we're back where we started. God willing, even at the worst it won't be as bad as the 22nd St. collapse.
So you work w numbers. Have u figured out my age yet?
No have u given clues? I'd say mid 30s
Did u see my 15:42?
No
I just re-sent. Did u get?
No
Heck with it. I prob. Shouldn't have used a Unicode character. I'm 64.
Factor of 2 :-)
Lol now it worked
? What I sent before included 27=3^3. I'm one step up. Hmm, that's ambiguous, but care to guess? :-) but with a superscript 3 for "cubed".
Haha looks like Ur good with numbers too
lections of his regular column in _Scientific American_.
Not professionally, and I'm a lousy bookkeeper. But I've enjoyed #games all my life. Did you ever read Martin Gardner's _Mathematical Games_ books?: Col
No. I'm more in to classic literature
Like…?
We talking about Dickens? Austen? Shakespeare? Cervantes? Dante? Vergil? Plato? Homer?
James Michener my fav...ever read?
I remember learning the word "hui"from _Hawaii_. Something like 'clan'.
I haven't read Hawaii yet...my dad told me that's one of the best
What ones have u read?
Centennial, Alaska, mexico, Texas
Alaska! I *thought* I remembered reading one about Alaska, but as a title it didn't ring a bell.
yes he is my idol
His titles are always geographic locations. What authors do u like?
Oh, .... Ursula Le Guin. Steven Brust. Classically, Heinlein, Asimov, Frederik Pohl. Among others. Diana Wynne Jones, Diane Duane.
They all sound foreign
Later... I'm having gelato downtown w my son, then driving home. Sorry for the interruption, explain later.
Haha its fine. I'm with a friend as well
How was your night
up :-( . Its been nice chatting w u. I hope we get another chance... Seems likely.
Ok but I can't chat now. Got to finish breakfast and drive out to a med appt , and by the time I've driven back into town to the office our time will be
OK have a good day
U2
